item.title: Phasmophobia: Best Mods You Need To Try
item.description:
Highlights

  • Communication is key in Phasmophobia - failing to do so can lead to a game over sooner rather than later.
  • Mods are essential to keep the game fresh after exploring all the base content of Phasmophobia .
  • Players can use mods like Definity Reshade and Fred Durst Ghost Audio Replacement to enhance their gameplay experience.

Phasmophobia is one of the best horror games in quite some time. The focus on co-op gameplay could have killed the mood of this game, but it's the ingenious way in which Phasmophobia works around these mechanics that makes it one of the most innovative titles around. Communication is key in this title, and failing to do so means that a game over will come sooner rather than later. Of course, the base game can only keep players satisfied for so long. The content of the game might be strong, but it's not exactly populated. As a result, most players decided to download some mods to make the game more engaging.

There are many great mods players can download to augment the experience of playing Phasmophobia . The game is easily one of the best co-op experiences players can subject themselves to, letting them have a great time with their friends before the ghost inevitably comes to spoil the party. Players may struggle early on in this title, but it doesn't take too long to understand how the game works before expertly identifying and exorcising the many demons present in this unique game. Suffice it to say, fans who have explored all the content Phasmophobia has to offer should definitely focus on mods to freshen up their playthroughs.

Updated on June 8th, 2024, by Ritwik Mitra: Most people would assume that co-op functionality means that the effect of horror games would be reduced a bit, but this isn't necessarily the case. In fact, Phasmophobia lets a group of ghost hunters try to exorcise these demons in one of the scariest video games of the modern era via an ingenious use of voice chat where the volume of players lessens the further they are from each other. This makes for a great time, as players struggle to band together and figure out how to get rid of a ghost, and anyone who has seen everything the base game has to offer can use these mods to freshen up the experience.

How to Install Mods

Phasmophobia doesn't have official modding support, meaning that players must alter the files in the base game to integrate the vast majority of these mods. This may sound unnerving, but players don't need to worry. All they need to do is follow the instructions for each mod, which are present on their description page. For the sake of convenience, each mod has its own page linked in its entry here for players who are interested.

  • Installing mods in the majority of mods are a simple case of overwriting files. Players should check the files that are being overwritten if they're planning to install multiple mods to avoid any conflicts or mismatched textures and the like.
  • If players wish to uninstall these mods , then all they need to do is verify the integrity of game files on Steam to bring back the original version of this game. If this isn't viable, then a reinstall always works .

It may not be the most intuitive way to install or remove mods, but that's what happens when games don't have mod support but still boast a passionate community who want to mold said game in their own way, and Phasmophobia is a great example of a video game that came out of nowhere to endear itself to the masses in no time.

21 Definity Reshade Phasmophobia

Downloads: 449

  • Creator: AdamJensen2029
  • Download Link

Reshades are a dime a dozen in the realm of modding, so something must be special to justify checking out. Thankfully, the Definity Reshade Phasmophobia is a reshade that fans can potentially have a great time with.

The effect this reshade has on the game's looks is pretty astounding, and worth using for anyone who feels that the game has started looking a bit too stale for their liking. The mileage of this reshade can vary, but players can always check out this mod and remove it from the game if it doesn't align with their interests.

20 No Crosshair

Downloads: 304

  • Creator: VeeAyeInIn
  • Download Link

Crosshairs are downright necessary in almost every game with a first-person perspective. It gives players a general idea of what they're looking at, making it easier for them to focus their perspective and select the things they want. However, in Phasmophobia, immersion is a huge part of what makes the experience so magical. Some players feel that a crosshair can take them out of that, giving them the sense of relief that this scary game is exactly that — a game, and nothing more.

While this may be a small change, players can still go the extra mile and remove the crosshair from the game if they're fairly adept in playing first-person games. It's not a huge miss, and it lets players easily get into this amazing title and get scared out of their wits with nothing on their screen except for the ghost that's haunting them.

19 Fred Durst Ghost Audio Replacement

Downloads: 318

  • Creator: RoosterBastion
  • Download Link

Limp Bizkit is a band that many people love to hate. Even fans of the band love to deride their edgy lyrics and performances even now. Still, there's no denying that this band has created some great songs, and Fred Durst's vocals are the most iconic part of this package that people can instantly recognize. This vocalist has an instantly recognizable voice that players can add to the horror of Phasmophobia to turn this horrifying title into a tragic comedy of sorts.

As long as players have enjoyed Phasmophobia to their hearts' content and don't mind messing with the game's vibe a bit, it goes without saying that replacing most of the scary audio in the game with Fred's vocals will make for a hilarious time. While players can still be scared by the visuals of the ghost, the audio that accompanies these sightings will lead to players bursting out in laughter.

18 Replace Cursed Music Box Music With Mergo's Lullaby From Bloodborne

Downloads: 430

  • Creator: Box_McNug
  • Download Link

Bloodborne is one of the scariest and most engaging action RPGs made by FromSoftware. The title is in a class of its own, wowing players with its immaculate presentation, brooding atmosphere, nightmarish enemies, and a combat system that prioritized aggression to a whole new level. Suffice it to say, many fans fell in love with the game. Some people even go so far as to call it Hidetaka Miyazaki's magnum opus — a bold choice of words, especially when one considers the fact that this director played a central role in the creation of Elden Ring .

Given how in tune Bloodborne is with horror tropes and motifs, it's easy to see why some Phasmophobia fans wouldn't mind this coveted Soulsborne title to make its presence known in this co-op ghost-hunting title too. This can be achieved pretty easily with a mod that adds the haunting Mergo's Lullaby to the game. It replaces the tones from the Cursed Music Box, making for a rather eerie tone that can certainly unnerve players, especially if they know the story behind Mergo and her existence.

17 Phasmophobia Save Editor

Downloads: 7,185

  • Creator: dziubbas
  • Download Link

Sometimes, the best mods are the simplest ones. While stuff like visual overhauls and gameplay enhancements certainly make up a chunk of the more popular mods for any video game, some players just want to boot up a mod that lets them change existing parameters in the game of their choice without too much fuss. Players seeking out such a mod for Phasmophobia will find the Save Editor to be right up their alley.

This mod essentially functions as a trainer, letting players alter most of the metrics in the game. This includes a player's funds and level, to name a few. While the fun in Phasmophobia revolves around how challenging this game can get, most players won't mind a simple mod that allows them to circumvent the challenge after investing a lot of hours in this title.

16 Jojo's Bizarre Adventures Tarot Cards

Downloads: 534

  • Creator: NoobTriesToWin and ACasualOnion
  • Download Link

JoJo's Bizarre Adventure is one of the most popular anime around. Araki's magnum opus had been running for decades, which made it puzzling for so many fans that no official anime adaptation had been greenlit for the same. Thankfully, David Production stepped up to the task, working on a less-than-ideal budget to develop a hyper-stylized anime that took the world by storm and made JoJo's Bizarre Adventure a household name overseas in no time flat.

The fanbase of this series is so rabid that they've gone to great lengths to add references to this show in anything and everything they can find, and Phasmophobia is no exception to this golden rule. Given the prominence of tarot cards in this title, it was only a matter of time before a fan would add a JoJo reference to this game.

15 Cats Tarot

Downloads: 1,175

  • Creator: Nezertiam
  • Download Link

The tarot cards in Phasmophobia are fascinating yet dangerous cursed items that can have a range of random negative or positive effects on the player. Drawing a tarot card can be a risky gamble, although every player who finds this deck of cursed cards will want to use it just to see how a playthrough can change with a single card.

In the vanilla game, tarot cards feature fitting and unnerving illustrations. However, players can flip the script and turn these tarot cards into a source of unending hilarity by downloading the Cats Tarot mod. Even if players draw a card that instantly kills them, seeing a funny cat meme moments before their demise will make for one of the most hilarious experiences they've had while playing Phasmophobia .

14 Halo's Reshade Preset

Downloads: 3,245

  • Creator: halo57634
  • Download Link

Reshades are some of the most common types of mods for any video game, as these visual changes can be easily integrated into most modern titles. Phasmophobia is no exception here, and the game has received its fair share of fan reshades that augment the look of the game.

One such mod is Halo's Reshade Preset, which adds to the vibrancy and sharpness of the game's visuals. The title also gets a bit darker, which can add to the spookiness. However, players should keep in mind that reshades can be aggressive with their implementation of darkness, and that is the case with this mod. This can lead to the game map being a bit harder to navigate, especially given how dingy most of the levels in Phasmophobia already are.

13 Simple PhotoRealistic Reshade

Downloads: 3,435

  • Creator: ArmeT
  • Download Link

Sometimes, reshades don't need to be impressive visual enhancements that end up making the game look extremely sharp. After all, this can come at the cost of performance, which most players don't want to sacrifice. For many, the best reshade is one that doesn't tax the hardware too much and keeps the original visuals of the title intact, while adding a few minor improvements.

This is accomplished with the Simple PhotoRealistic Reshade mod, which makes simple adjustments to the game's visuals that make Phasmophobia look more realistic. The best part is that this upgrade is achieved with minimal cost to performance, which will be a source of great news for fans.

12 Phasmo Gadget

Downloads: 5,790

  • Creator: Shaklin
  • Download Link

There are several ghost types present in Phasmophobia . Trying to differentiate between all these types can be a substantial ordeal, mainly due to their looming presence on the players. With the Phasmo Gadget mod, players can have a better idea of how to identify ghost types within the game.

It's a great way to streamline the experience and make it more accessible for players, especially those starting out. Some people may argue that this mod makes the game too easy, but any mod that makes games easier to play should be lauded.

11 Among Us Tarot Cards

Downloads: 2,106

  • Creator: MoreOver
  • Download Link

Speaking of indie multiplayer games that have become a phenomenon, it would be impossible not to talk about the immense popularity of Among Us . The game grew to immense popularity during the pandemic. Players loved the idea of banding together with their crewmates and trying to thwart the murderous attempts of an impostor.

This mod adds the crewmates from Among Us into Phasmophobia as tarot card images. It's a hilarious mod that fans will love, especially if immersion is not their utmost priority and they have fond memories of playing this great game at a time when social contact was heavily limited.

10 Exorcist — Let's ReShade Phasmophobia

Downloads: 1,739

  • Creator: OpethEthereal
  • Download Link

Players can download several reshade mods to almost any game to completely change the experience. After all, a visual overhaul is a great way to make any game more interesting in this department.

The Exorcist reshade mod is one of the more extensive ones on this list. It makes the game run purely in black and white while also making images more vivid, leaning heavily on the terrifying atmosphere of the game.

9 Scooby-Doo Edition

Downloads: 21,808

  • Creator: BigManJD
  • Download Link

The cooperative nature of Phasmophobia makes for some of its best moments. In fact, most people would say that it feels like a great cartoon about a bunch of friends hunting down paranormal activities.

Players who love Scooby-Doo can replicate the feelings of the same with the Scooby-Doo Edition mod for Phasmophobia . It's a great mod that lets players feel like the bumbling gang as they track down ghosts to the best of their abilities.

8 Fossu's Light And Dark ReShade

Downloads: 13,275

  • Creator: Fossu
  • Download Link

Phasmophobia can be a fun game at times, but it's still a horror game at the end of the day. This is where Fossu's Light and Dark ReShade mod comes into the picture.

There are several mods that tweak the graphics of Phasmophobia in some way or the other. However, Fossu's reshade mod makes the game extremely creepy and atmospheric for players who want to get immersed in the act of hunting down ghosts.

7 Phasmophobia Assistant

Downloads: 10,012

  • Creator: Ghost aka Boring Life
  • Download Link

Phasmophobia might seem like a simple game, but it actually features a surprising amount of variety. Players who want this game to feel even more fleshed out can try the Phasmophobia Assistant.

This mod adds a simple tool to the game that lets players tweak a ton of aspects of the game. It also serves as a record of sorts that will aid players in their investigations.

6 Horror Ambiance

Downloads: 7,914

  • Creator: Moore Gaming
  • Download Link

There are several elements of Phasmophobia that lend to its creepy atmosphere. The audio definitely does its job here, but some players might want the ambiance of the title to be stepped up a notch.

Horror Ambiance is a great mod in this regard. It changes some of the audio files in the vanilla game to make ambient noises a consistent source of eeriness and fear throughout the game.

5 Ghostbusters Radio

Downloads: 3,927

  • Creator: Robotnic25
  • Download Link

The radio present in Phasmophobia is easily one of the best features in the game. The manner in which this radio serves as a great source of communication before fading away as the distance between players increases is a surprisingly engaging gameplay mechanic.

That being said, there's no reason why this radio should feature some custom sounds of its own. With the Ghostbusters Radio mod, the usual sound of the radio is cheerily replaced by the Ghostbusters theme song.

4 Ghostbusters Edition

Downloads: 3,509

  • Creator: xxxDESPERADOxxx
  • Download Link

Of course, the radio doesn't need to be the only place where players stop with the whole Ghostbusters transformation. After all, Phasmophobia as a concept can be compared to the camaraderie of Ghostbusters, and changing up the game to truly get immersed in this universe can be a great way to spice up the gameplay.

The Ghostbusters Edition mod does exactly what most people would expect. It alters the textures of the game to add a bunch of Ghostbusters items and secrets, making for a unique experience as players engage in a bout of ghost hunting.

3 Cam's Reshade Preset

Downloads: 6,435

  • Creator: Cam
  • Download Link

Darkness is an element of horror games that makes things way more mysterious and spine-chilling. To crank the darkness up to a hundred in a game like Phasmophobia is pretty much a recipe for unlimited scares.

Cam's Reshade Preset accomplishes exactly that. That being said, the muted lighting lends itself to a tasteful-looking title that will look quite pretty as most players are getting scared out of their wits.

2 New TV

Downloads: 3,584

  • Creator: Omar
  • Download Link

Most horror movies and shows use the noise and screen of a TV to great effect. It's a common trope that can be quite effective, but Phasmophobia doesn't really use a TV's presence to its fullest potential.

With the New TV mod, players can enjoy this small yet noticeable change in their game. It might be a predictable inclusion, but a welcome one nevertheless.

item.title: June 13 is a Big Day for The Finals
item.description:
Highlights

  • Summer Games Fest 2024 unveiled exciting updates for The Finals, a title that surpassed Call of Duty's player count in just 5 days when it initially debuted.
  • The Finals Season 3 trailer showcased massive content updates, a new Ranked League system, and a feudal Japan setting.
  • Embark Studio is adding new weapons, gadgets, and competitive elements to breathe new life into The Finals in June.

Summer Games Fest 2024 unveiled an exciting lineup of upcoming games and updates, including key announcements about the future of The Finals . Initially launched in December 2023, the chaotic PVP shooter took the world by storm with its adrenaline-pumping action, destructible environments, and emphasis on teamwork. The Finals even surpassed Call of Duty 's player count on Steam within the first five days of being released.

Excitement for Embark Studio's shooter is reigniting following the latest trailer. Scheduled for June 13, The Finals will debut its third season alongside massive content updates, including a new Ranked League system and a brand-new map. Additionally, the introduction of new, never-before-seen weaponry is expected to provide players with more variety, especially since the game currently offers only 24 weapons as of Season 2.

The Finals Is Rolling Out a Major Content Update on June 13

The Finals Is Traveling To Feudal Japan

Despite its brevity, Embark Studio's Season 3 trailer packed a wealth of new content in just over a minute. For those eager to fight in a new arena, the upcoming map, Kyoto 1568, promises to satisfy their craving for fresh battlegrounds. Although The Finals ' feudal Japan setting arrives amid a market saturated with similar themes, the teaser has already captivated viewers with its breathtaking visuals, showcasing lush bamboo forests and intricate temples.

Furthermore, each build will receive new weapons and gadgets, including but not necessarily limited to:

  • Recurve Bow (a weapon for Lights)
  • Thermal Bore (a gadget for Lights)
  • Dual Katanas (a melee weapon for Mediums)
  • Spear (a melee weapon for Heavies)
  • Winch Claw (a specialization for Heavies)

Since the beta, fans have clamored for the bow's arrival. Interestingly, the katana, with its ability to deflect bullets in a nod to Japanese combat, has also managed to steal the spotlight. This influx of new weaponry, heavily inspired by Japanese combat tactics, is poised to shake up the established meta in The Finals .

Embark Studios Seeks To Emphasize The Finals' Competitive Elements

Acknowledging some players' observations that The Finals lacks certain features, Season 3 aims to breathe new life into the game. Notably, developers have revealed that Ranked will now include Terminal Attack, a 5v5 mode initially available to casual players in Season 2. While Terminal Attack sparked debate in March due to the absence of healing or revival, its integration into Ranked adds a thrilling layer of strategic depth. While it may be too soon to say for certain, its inclusion in competitive play should add an intriguing dynamic where every decision carries much more weight.

In addition, the competitive landscape in The Finals is about to receive a significant boost with the introduction of the World Tour. This new feature goes beyond the traditional Ranked ladder, offering a dynamic and ever-evolving playground for skilled players to truly test their mettle. Each week presents fresh challenges in the form of unique in-game events and tournaments, each featuring distinct rules, load-outs, and rewards. Victories will propel participants up the online leaderboard and unlock badges ranging from Bronze, Silver, and Gold.

Notably, the ultimate glory awaits those who can rise above the competition. Exceptional performance throughout the World Tour events accumulates throughout the season and can earn Multibucks. Multibucks are a valuable currency in The Finals , typically obtained through microtransactions. As such, dominating the World Tour can grant players a generous amount, giving them an advantage in acquiring new gear, cosmetics, or even future Battle Passes. Overall, with such exciting innovations coming in The Finals' third season, June 13 should be an incredibly promising day for the class-based shooter.

item.title: Silent Hill 2: 6 Most Impactful James Sunderland Quotes, Ranked
item.description:
James Sunderland has become one of the most recognizable protagonists in the video game horror genre ever since he first appeared in Silent Hill 2 back in 2001. What makes James so fondly remembered by horror fans is how relatable he is as a character. He isn't a special agent sent in to clean up the streets of Silent Hill from monsters, but instead, is simply a troubled man whose overwhelming grief leads him down a long and very dark path.

Throughout this personal journey, James comes out with several few quotes which have ended up being quite impactful, whether it was because they revealed a lot about the character, or just the sick and twisted nature of Silent Hill itself. James has had his fair share of memorable lines throughout his respective game, but the ones listed below have stood the test of time as fan favorites since the release of the original Silent Hill 2 . Before jumping in, please be advised that this list will contain minor spoilers for the story of Silent Hill 2 .

6 "I Guess I Really Don't Care If It's Dangerous Or Not"

James' Numbness To The World Around Him Starts To Show

Though he doesn't realize it until much later in the story, Silent Hill 2 is all about James facing his guilty conscience, which includes him finding a way to punish himself for his past actions. Nowhere is this more clear than at the beginning of the game during James' baffling interaction with Angela. At first, James seems cautious about whether the Silent Hill town is dangerous or not, but after a moment, he realizes deep down, he doesn't care "If it's dangerous or not".

The truth is, James could be walking into a literal minefield, but the guilt that constantly hangs over his head has made him numb to the fear - pushing him to constantly put his life in danger as a form of self-punishment. It's a haunting line that provides an early indication of James' fractured mental state, and his numbness to the horrors that surround him.

5 "How Can You Just Sit There And Eat Pizza?"

A Hilarious Line Which Contains Some Subtle Foreshadowing For Eddie

The Silent Hill games don't often get much of a chance to insert comedy into their dark stories, but one hilarious bit of dialogue that has stuck with many fans over the years comes during James' talk with Eddie in the bowling alley. James, having just fought through hordes of horrific monsters, is shocked to see Eddie sitting down and enjoying a fresh box of pizza, as if he's completely oblivious to what's happening in the town.

The truth is, while this line initially comes off as pretty funny, it's also a subtle bit of foreshadowing of Eddie's own personal insecurities, and what drove him to Silent Hill in the first place. James was let off the hook this time, but things don't end quite as smoothly when he mocks Eddie about food later in the game.

4 "Don't Worry, I'm Not Crazy. Least, I Don't Think So..."

James Makes Players Wonder If What They're Seeing Is Real, Or Just His Imagination

At first, it might seem like James is the only sane person left in Silent Hill, especially after running into Angela and Eddie, but it doesn't take long to realize James too is also losing his grip on reality, despite how much he likes to claim he isn't. What makes this quote so chilling, aside from Guy Cihi's incredibly eerie vocal delivery, is the fact it shows James is truthfully uncertain about why he even came to Silent Hill, and why he's going through all of these 'trials' to find someone who he knows is already long gone.

It's also a subtle way to suggest to players that James is an unreliable narrator who could very well be making up all of this in his own head. Making James this vulnerable as a character is one of the many reasons why so many horror fans have come to see him as such an amazing protagonist.

3 "A Dead Person Can't Write A Letter"

The Mystery Of Why James Received The Letter Is A Perfect Hook For The Game's Story

On the surface, this quote might seem like an obvious statement if it were coming from anyone else, but for James, it says a lot about his conflicted mindset and hypocrisy. During his small monologue at the beginning of the game, James is constantly trying to convince himself the mysterious letter he received couldn't be from his wife, even going as far as to clarify to himself that "A dead person can't write a letter".

It's a clear indication of James' mind going back and forth on whether to believe his wife really could be out there somewhere, waiting for him in their "special place". Right from the get-go, the game reveals that James isn't exactly in the best state of mind for starting his journey, and it immediately creates a sense of mystery about the character, and forces players to question why he's honestly venturing into the depths of Silent Hill.

2 "I Was Weak. That's Why I Needed You...Needed Someone To Punish Me For My Sins"

James Finally Realizes The True Meaning Behind The Pyramid Head

It's been well documented that the monsters in Silent Hill 2 all act as metaphors for the underlying feelings and suppressed emotions of the characters, and for James, the Pyramid Head is an executioner who is constantly trying to kill him as a way to atone for his sins. Though the Pyramid Head makes several appearances throughout the story, it's not until the end of the game when two pop up at once that James finally realizes who they are, what they mean, and what he must do next.

Most players will start to piece these ideas in their head throughout their playthrough, but seeing James himself acknowledge his desire for punishment, and starting to stand up against it, is a very memorable and pretty epic moment in the series. What ensues after this classic quote is a brutal fight which is often seen as among one of the hardest in the game.

1 "Mary?"

Guilt, Denial, Acceptance, James Has Been Through It All

Though it's only a single word, this quote is said by James many times throughout Silent Hill 2 , and it's emblematic of his confusion of current events, and his denial of the past. James is always chasing his wife Mary, even though he knows deep down she's gone, and as a result, he manages to see glimpses of his late wife in a new character who looks just like her, that being Maria.

James mistakenly calls Maria Mary on a few occasions throughout the game, and it's as if he's desperately trying to convince himself that he's found her, even though the two women have completely different personalities. It can also feel as though James is speaking to his wife directly when bringing up her name, which becomes much more relevant in the later stages of the story where he does finally manage to make peace with himself after talking with her one final time.

item.title: Far Cry: Vaas Montenegro Isn't FC3's Only Source for Villain Inspiration
item.description:
Highlights

  • Far Cry 7 may see a significant change with the introduction of an in-game timer affecting the villain's characterization.
  • The next game's villain could be inspired by FC3's protagonist, Jason Brody, adding a new twist to the traditional villain archetype.
  • Bringing back Jason Brody as a villain in FC7 could connect back to previous elements, providing an interesting development in the series.

Far Cry has been unusually quiet since the most recent entry in the long-running open-world FPS series. After 2021's sixth main installment, Far Cry news and updates have been sparse and sporadic, and very little official information has been made known about the assumed next game's progress and direction. Previously, the franchise had a steady release schedule, and fans had come to expect a new title every few years, starting with Far Cry 3 in 2012.

Although developer Ubisoft has been largely silent since Far Cry 6 , various leaks and secondary insider information have come to light, pointing to possible changes and shakeups to its established formula. One of Far Cry 's traditions that has consistently been integral, though, is its villain, and this is very likely to be true for FC7, regardless of other aspects. And while FC3 's Vaas is the most popular and obvious candidate to inform the next entry's big bad, there is another character who could be primed for the same treatment— previous protagonist Jason Brody.

A more persistent rumor is that Far Cry 7 will feature an in-game timer in some form, which could inform how its villain/s may be presented or characterized.

Far Cry 3 spoilers below.

Far Cry 3's Jason Brody Could Be the Source of the Next Game's Villain Inspiration

Far Cry 3's Vaas Montenegro May Be its Most Famous Antagonist, but Ubisoft Has Another Option

Vaas has long been a Far Cry fan favorite, often regarded as the best and most memorable villain the series has introduced, and yet to be topped. His mark on the franchise and gaming overall has left a creative issue that Ubisoft has been attempting to solve ever since Vaas arrived on the scene and instantly captivated players with his disturbing outlook and actions. However, protagonist Jason Brody was also an incredibly arresting character, and given his actions and experiences in the events of FC3 's plot as well as depending on some other factors, could be fit into a villain role in the future.

How Far Cry 3's Jason Brody Might Appear as the Next Great FC Villain

Jason Brody's journey in Far Cry 3 from a privileged and carefree twenty-something to a hardened guerrilla fighter and touted champion of Rook Island's Rakyat tribe is one of the most fascinating and, at times, uncomfortable character arcs in gaming. Unlike many FPS, Jason does not start out with any combat skills or training, and is forced to adapt to violent ways in order to survive and save his friends and family from Vaas and his co-conspirators. By the end, Jason has a lot of blood on his hands, and he struggles with reconciling this and the choices he made throughout. FC3 's ending also gave players the choice to have Jason embrace his newfound identity by sacrificing his friends and ultimately himself, or return from the brink, though still scarred and changed greatly from the experience.

There is another interesting parallel in the original Far Cry protagonist Jack Carver, who fans had theorized and suspected was the insidious Jackal in FC2 . This was later confirmed as intended to be the case by Far Cry 2 director, Clint Hocking. As rumors also suggest Far Cry 7 could be drawing heavily from earlier titles, there is thus already precedent for a prior protagonist making a face-heel turn. Something similar along these lines would hypothetically set up Jason to return in such a capacity, coming full circle in Far Cry 7 .

Other unconfirmed information points to the next Far Cry featuring a cult as a collective antagonist, bringing to mind Joseph Seed and his "family" from Far Cry 5 . It would likely be a big surprise and shock to players if Jason Brody returns in FC7 , having fully turned into a villainous figure, perhaps as the leader or in a powerful position within this cult. Seeing him return in this fashion would be an interesting and compelling way of connecting back to previous elements, while evolving the character in a manner befitting Far Cry 's tone and themes.

item.title: Creative Minecraft Player Brings a Chunk of the Nether Into The Overworld
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Nether in Minecraft is treacherous, but essential for those who want to gather rare items like Netherite. As such, it has become iconic.
  • A talented Minecraft player recently went out of their way to recreate the dangerous dimension in the Overworld, building a large cube that looks just like a piece of the Nether and features key landmarks from the locale.

A Minecraft player set out to recreate a part of the Nether in the Overworld, achieving an impressive result. Minecraft is a game famous for allowing players to bring their most imaginative ideas to life, but for those players who also like to explore the game's blocky world, there are some rather dangerous places to visit.

Among these high-risk places is the Nether, the dimension that functions as Minecraft 's underworld. When Minecraft players make obsidian to craft the Nether portal, they access a dimension characterized by not having a day and night cycle, and by having unique biomes. Some of these are the Basalt Deltas, one of the most dangerous biomes in the game, and the Soul Sand Valley, the Nether "desert." Visiting the Nether requires preparation from Minecraft players, but one creative adventurer decided to flip things on their head with a recreation of the dimension in the overworld.

Reddit user Consistent-Hand-3404 reproduced a chunk of the Nether in Minecraft 's Overworld. Without the help of any mods and using only a structure block, they created a chunk with several huge fungi, a type of "tree" generated in two biomes of the Nether, the Crimson Forests and Warped Forests. The player's recreation includes a section of Glowstone, the block generated in the Nether known for emitting light, and part of the Nether Fortress, a large structure that hides dangers such as wither skeletons and blazes. Next to the chunk, they've placed a portal used by Minecraft players to visit the Nether, and included the lower layers of the dimension, with dangerous rivers of lava.

What Can Minecraft Players do in the Nether?

Although it is a remarkably dangerous dimension, Minecraft places items in the Nether that are must-have for players who have traveled there. Ancient Debris is found in the Nether's lowest points and is smelted to create Netherite Ingots, valuable items that make diamond armor even more powerful. If a Minecraft player is thinking of reaching The End, they will need Blaze Rods, which are used to craft Blazing Powder, an essential item for making the Eye of Enders and activating the End Portal. Nether Warts are small fungi that have few uses, the main one being brewing.

The Nether is one of the most popular aspects of Minecraft gameplay, and it got big love in 2020. Called "The Nether Update," the patch gave the Nether a major overhaul by adding new blocks such as soul fire, basalt, and ancient debris. Netherite armor, a material tougher than diamond, was introduced in the Nether Update, along with Netherite tools. Minecraft has also added new hazards in the form of hostile mobs such as Piglin, Strider, and Hoglin, insuring the Nether remains relevant years after its debut.
